title: How to add counterplay to Darius W -> Q for immobile champions
body:
Make his W only slow by half the total amount when moving towards him, that way you can more reasonably "dodge" the Q by moving into it since that was the intended counterplay.

This doesn't affect his ability to catch targets, since a target running away will probably not want to move closer to the person chasing them, but it does add more reasonable counterplay for immobile champions to duel Darius in lane.

I don't think Darius needs nerfs or anything, I'd be fine if he got some sort of compensation for this (really don't think he'd need it though), I just think this change needs to happen to make laning against him as an immobile champion more feasible.

Edit: after some thought I realize this only really matters very early on. It would be totally fine if this effect scaled down with rank or level (ie. 50/62.5/75/87.5/100% of slow amount when moving towards him)

Darius falls of.

He doesn't fall of numbers wise because he's not supposed to; he's supposed to always be a ticking time-bomb of a damage threat which can soak some punishment and also heal a decent amount in ideal cases.

Darius falls off in that he's totally immobile (summoners not withstanding), has to 'warm up' before he starts to hurt, has a very small threat range, and doesn't have the tank steroids needed to survive a sustained focus fire. After lane phase you're supposed to control and ignore / focus fire him, because he's tough but not tanky and sticky but not a catcher.

Yeah this is pretty much every juggernaut. They fall off in the sense that later enemies deal exponentially more damage and start ignoring resistances, taking juggernauts down faster than they can approach through the CC.

Their damage was never meant to fall off, just the application of it in teamfights naturally gets harder due to the class’s weakness—immobility.
He doesn't need to fall off if he can't catch most of your team. He can get to a point where he cant be killed, but so can many champs. He gets dumpstered by anti-tanks and ranged carries.
